Sangoma JSR309 API Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
CodecHelper class that contains media format related information
EventThis class is defines the basic interface for an event
EventListenerThis class specifiy the basic interface for any event listeners
JoinableA Joinable is suitable for media composition. A Joinable object is either a NetworkConnection, a MediaGroup, or a MediaMixer (base of a Conference application). It can also be a Stream (audio, video, ...) of any of those objects. Joinables can be joined/unjoined, to make the media stream flow between them. Join operations can be limited both to a stream (i.e audio,video, see JoinableStream.StreamType) and direction (i.e. kSend, kReceive, kDuplex, see Joinable.Direction). The join direction can be changed by calling join again, with a different Direction
JoinableContainerA Joinable object that contains multiple streams. Provides accessors to objects representing those streams. A JoinableStream is also a Joinable, and can be used in place of its container, to restrict a join operation for example. A JoinableContainer has a non-mutable number of streams, determined when the object is built. When a JoinableContainer A is joined to another JoinableContainer B, each stream of A is joined to the corresponding stream of B: audio to audio, video to video, etc
JoinableStreamA JoinableStream represents a media stream channel (or port), of a given type: audio, video, etc. It is a Joinable and as such, can be used as an argument to join. A JoinableStream has always one parent JoinableContainer, and that parent cannot change. Operating on JoinableStreams instead of their JoinableContainer, enables stream-specific compositions, like muting only the video, or sending the video to a different object
LoggerInterface class that needs to be implemented by the user of API to configure the logging module
MediaConfigConfiguration object for the JSR309 API. This object has methods to help the user add elements in the boost::property_tree::ptree that is kept as a member of this class. Users that wants to use the boost object directly can by calling the ptree() method which returns a reference to the underlying ptree object
MediaObjectBased class for various media objects created with the JSR309 API
MediaServerLostEventEvent generated when the API is having problem to communicate with the media resources on the D-series card
MediaSessionInterface class for JSR309 Media Sessions
MSControlFactoryThis class is responsible of creating new Media Session. The MSControlFactory manages the resources available on the configured D-series cards
NetworkConnectionA NetworkConnection is a JoinableContainer that drives network media ports
